website_summaries.verdict: Top-of-the line construction & brushed stainless steel make this pot one to consider for pros & those w/high-end kitchens. From a reputable brand, this model can perform numerous tasks.
pros: Wide bottom allows for sautéing and making sauce
cons: May be too pricey for casual cooks
Handles can get hotter than advertised
Some owners question stainless steel quality

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously sharp rim. Sliced my hand
customer_reviews.text: I know my ratings are crazy. The main issue with this pot is that the pot rim is extremely sharp. Sliced me sharp. It isn’t rolled or dull. It’s dangerous. I wish I hadn’t waited so long to discover this or BACK it would have gone. Ridiculous price. And price is no object on a good product. Don’t purchase. Find another. I thought it was possibly just me. So I pull out the pot and ask what friends think. Comments start with “that rim is dangerous” please pass.
customer_reviews.author: Here's the dish

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This pot is actually a bit bigger than I expected, but I love it. It's extremely weighty when liquid is added, making it a task to move around. I primarily use the pot for soups and herbal teas for which it works wonderfully. I've owned other All-Clad product lines, and this is definitely nicer than all the others I've owned. I'd buy this again, and may get an additional piece or 2 from the series.
customer_reviews.author: Bookmaven

customer_reviews.title: SCRATCHES TOO EASILY
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product...Scratches too easily because they use cheap quality steel...Also, made in 'Murika.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this All Clad brand soup pot. It feels substantially made. I wanted to try out this D5 before the expense of a bigger pot with the 7 layers. The 5 layers is better than most posts but it still doesn't distribute heat like a crockpot or slow cooker. I am still giving a 5 rating because you can feel and see the quality of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: grannylinda

customer_reviews.title: Pitted after first use
customer_reviews.text: Pitted after making one batch of soup. No salt added until late in the cooking process. Googling reveals other similar experiences. What a disappointment, not to say disaster! Thank god I bought from Amazon so return was easy. I've heard the All-Clad customer service is unhelpful.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Willer

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: Feels and looks (and costs!) like a premium product. Heats evenly. Handles don't really get too hot. We are using this on an induction stovetop. The only downside to having such a beautiful pot like this is that you take extra precautions when using it because you don't want to damage it -- we also never wash this in the dishwasher (even though it is dishwasher-safe), as the instructions note that handwashing will extend its lifetime (which I'm guessing will probably be my lifetime).
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful pot! On occasion the burner was inadvertently left ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful pot! On occasion the burner was inadvertently left on high for an extended period. My food did not scorch or burn.
customer_reviews.author: lue

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This worked better than my four quart Le Creuset. Although they’re technically different pots, I got much better searing with the All-Clad which lead to a better-looking and more tender beef soup. On a gas range at least, it was possible to reach a stable simmer quickly whereas the Le Creuset had me chasing after a light bubbling simmer all over the dial. The best feature of the Le Creuset (heat retention) became a slightly frustrating game of cat and mouse. Although the All-Clad may not have the same heat retention, it wasn’t a problem for me and worked quite well.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: After inheriting a few nice pieces of All-Clad
customer_reviews.text: After inheriting a few nice pieces of All-Clad, we found we were missing a pot of this particular size. Great pot, and works great with the new induction range we just bought.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McGee

customer_reviews.title: A great pot if you cook large batches
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy cooking soups and stews, you will love this pot. I double most of my recipes so that they yield 8-10 meals for my wife and I (we freeze the leftovers in 3.75 c. containers) and this pot cooks great. And Amazon had the best price I found.
customer_reviews.author: W. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Searching For
customer_reviews.text: Was so happy to find this size - 8 quart. I have many all clad pieces and like them very much. Have two very larges stock pots, and another pot that is a 6 quart. This is a perfect size for those times that I am doubling a recipe and want several containers for freezing. The other pots were either way too big, or not big enough. Search several sites, and stores locally with hardly any that noted an 8 quart size - found the size right away at Amazon and as Prime member, got it right away - another need satisfied - very speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Barbwire

customer_reviews.title: A-One Cookware
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of cookware. Replaced a previous All-Clad pot that lasted 25 years. This stainless version is better as there is not likely to be any corrosion of aluminum. This bad boy is the current star of the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Blue in Washington (Barry Ballow)

customer_reviews.title: Great item .. but then its US all clad
customer_reviews.text: Its the pot I expected at the best price. Less than I paid 2 years ago at Macys with all sorts of discounts.
customer_reviews.author: 9 yards

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Described
customer_reviews.text: Capital Cookware sent this piece of cookware fast and was packaged well. Their product description was spot on and came better than described. I would order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tia Ake

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had all clad for 25 years. The pots are as good as when I first got them. Last forever and super high quality.
customer_reviews.author: claudia howard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stock Pot for an Induction Range
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product when we bought an induction range because our old stock pot was not induction compatible. Since we use the stock pot so much, we decided to purchase All-Clad. We're very glad we did. It works very well with our induction range, very good heat distribution and easy to clean. Reaches temperature quickly and maintains a precise simmer. We've had it about 3 months and have used it many times.
customer_reviews.author: Anne A

customer_reviews.title: A pleasant upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We have been very pleased with each of the All-Clad products that we've purchased. Form and function!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Swopes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully made and finished, a cut above anything else on the market. Well worth the investment, this will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pot!  Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I use this pot for cooking large amounts of beef with vegetables—beef stew using an old family recipe. The pot cooked evenly without any hotspots which is very important with such a large amount. Love it! Wish I had two.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia K

customer_reviews.title: Love this pot
customer_reviews.text: Love this pot. Only suggestion would be a small steam hole on the lid, sometimes when food is simmering the lid rattles from the steam. Still an awesome pot.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband. He wanted a new pot to make "Sunday Gravy" and soup. He loves the pot and compliments the design every time he cooks something in it. He likes how easy it is use and to clean up afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Momma

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cookware
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Great piece of cookware. Heats more efficiently than my current cookware. Should last anyone a lifetime. All-Clad is the only cookware brand you will ever need to buy.
customer_reviews.author: John Braly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Stock Pot
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic stock pot - great for my fav recipes. Cooking for one, meal prep or a big vat of comfort food - this pot does serve all my kitchen needs for stock pot.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaJasper

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, Investment quality pot
customer_reviews.text: Solid quality. Even heating. No hots spots on bottom. Proper sized handles. Not cheap but this is lifetime pot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. My 8 quart pot was purchased 28 years ago and still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and practical.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, heavy duty stockpot. With care I expect it to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pot
customer_reviews.text: Been using All Clad pots for many years. They are simply the best. Great heat distribution, easy to clean and they are beautifully made.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Moulin

customer_reviews.title: Great pot!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this pot a few times but so far I love it! I hope I can say that a few years from now.
customer_reviews.author: M Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great pot. We use it for making soup, chili, and you name it. It cooks evenly when browning and the finish looks great hanging from our pot rack.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great All Clad pot. A lot heavier than my others, must be the 5 ply. Handcrafted in the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.author: HBS

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: I have many All-Clad pots and this is another example of what a fine quality pot should be like. It is very thick and a great size for so many different dishes. I use it all the time. Would highly recommend. It's made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Denise D.

customer_reviews.title: An absolute must size pot
customer_reviews.text: a favorite go to stock pot that is used several times per week..I own 2 of them... cleans up beautifully with Barkeeper's Friend powder,
customer_reviews.author: J. Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pot
customer_reviews.text: Cooks the way I expected it to, makes a great pot of soup.
customer_reviews.author: douglas sutton

customer_reviews.title: We love all our all-clad pots
customer_reviews.text: We love all our all-clad pots! The only error was that we ordered brushed and it came stainless silver. Sticks out in our brushed collection as the shiny one!
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Very good temperature ditribution
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pot for homemade soups a number of times since purchase and am extremely satisfied with its quality and performance. However, I would have opted for a larger pot if I had it to do over again as three quarts has turned out to be extremely limiting.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: All Clad cookware is great, works well with induction cooktop
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected and excellent. We already have one pot just like it and needed a 2nd because our other big pot could not be used on an induction cooktop. We have been using all clad cookware for 10 or 15 years and have purchased them for our kids as they moved out. We have no interest in buying anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected. Great cooking. All-clad... expensive but a heirloom that I suspect my kid's kid will have. (Worth it.)
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Cooking Pot
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this brand - the product is beautiful and I typically leave it sitting out on my gas range. It is perfect for gas or electric; very heavy and won't warp. When I have food in it, I do need someone stronger than me to remove it from the cook top.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 2 person chili pot
customer_reviews.text: Solid stainless. Goes from stove to dishwasher for a snap cleanup. Getting heavy use for gumbo, one pot soups, noodles for two. No impact from dishwasher cleaners. Handles stay cool.
customer_reviews.author: N'boots

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully contructed, Durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 4 qt to round out the set we have used for two years. Only need Bar Keepers Friend to keep them polished. Chose them to avoid aluminum and Teflon coated cookware. Very even heating.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ocheltree

customer_reviews.title: Get the best and don’t look back.
customer_reviews.text: I just finished a Chimichanga fried up in this baby. I’m pretty happy, and my dog Jim who I shared it with is content and snoozing.
customer_reviews.author: genoaz

customer_reviews.title: Great stock pot
customer_reviews.text: Great stock pot. However, I scratched the bottom with a stupid Cuisinart Smart Stick Immersion Blender HB-155PC.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good quality great size
customer_reviews.text: I added this pot to my collection which I love. It is a good size to make soup to mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Terpak

customer_reviews.title: First time All Clad buyer
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy pot that heats evenly and is easy to clean. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: AlaCap

customer_reviews.title: Very Fine Cookware
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price! Beautifully made, heats evenly, makes me a better cook, and lasts a lifetime! Please improve the packing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized pot gets frequent use, trusted All-Clad quality.
customer_reviews.text: We own a set of All-Clad D5 pots and pans. This fits a great size need we desired that we didn't have. Has come in handy from day one and has the quality that we have come to expect from All-Clad. High recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: All-clad pot is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old soup pot with 4 quart all-clad soup pot. Handles keep your hands away from steam, sturdy and great for cooking pasta, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ccherbgarden

customer_reviews.title: grerat pot
customer_reviews.text: we have been going to all clad pots. This is a good one. Great size and we use it all the time. No negative thoughts at all
customer_reviews.author: Sreve Larson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty pan for convection range.
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm on our convection stove-top. Heats and boils much faster than other pans.
customer_reviews.author: Veev

customer_reviews.title: I love it, absolutely lovely pot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old Farberware pot with a now uneven bottom that I had used for 30 years. I love it, absolutely lovely pot ,I iuse it for making my soups and my spaghetti sauce. Easy to clean. Will never need to but another soup pot.
customer_reviews.author: North Woods

customer_reviews.title: Will last forever
customer_reviews.text: Great soup pot. Much cheaper than the 4 qt saucepan.
customer_reviews.author: Brent H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality good, like the heave duty. Only wish the lid would also have the same look as the pot and not shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for soup or chili. Can’t wait for cold weather and a pot of potato soup!
customer_reviews.author: B. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Brushed Stainless Pot
customer_reviews.text: Awesome All Clad pot. Beautiful Brushed look. Excellent Customer Service as well A++
customer_reviews.author: New Jersey customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits in with my All Clad Master Chef 2 perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in no time. Fits in with my All Clad Master Chef 2 perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford it - buy it
customer_reviews.text: Magnificent pot for soups and smaller size batches of veggies, potatoes, squash and pasta. Superb quality, as usual, and a price to match.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Induction stock pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great pot. works very well on induction range. Nothing else does.
customer_reviews.author: williameb

customer_reviews.title: All Clad Scores Big
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best ever All Clad. I had no idea the older styles could be improved for consistency of temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sterns

customer_reviews.title: all-clad 4 qt soup pot
customer_reviews.text: $$$ but it is a 5d and I really like it!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous and great size. Perfect for large pots of soup.
customer_reviews.author: seamomrun

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad BD55508 SS d5
customer_reviews.text: My spouse is very impressed with her new pot, so far we have no complaints and have high regard for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenji K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great at holding heat and heating evenly. Stainless inside and out...made in USA!
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: I love all my All-Clad cookware
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a large pot where I could cook large pots of soup which wouldn't stick. This does the job! I love all my All-Clad cookware. It's pricey but well-worth collecting and should last a life-time.
customer_reviews.author: tam

customer_reviews.title: Great pot.
customer_reviews.text: Ask any craftsperson if cheap tools work in their profession. All will tell you that they buy the best they can afford because it makes a significant in the result. Same goes for cooking. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worth the pricey cost!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful looking and cooks food so wonderfully. Wish the handles didn't get so hot and man it is heavier than what I'm accustomed to.
customer_reviews.author: the Moof

customer_reviews.title: All clad 5d pot
customer_reviews.text: Great cooking pot! It cooks evenly and doesn't seem to interact with the food that is being cooked. BEAUTIFUL ADDITION TO THE KITCHEN EQUIPMENT.
customer_reviews.author: miche

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment. First time I used it I boiled water
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment. First time I used it I boiled water, and marks and rust showed up in the brushed stainless steel grooves, all over. Boiling water. No salt added, and I had washed the pot before using. My 20 year old RevereWare pot has no rust or marks on it. Is this truly a AllClad pan? For close to $300 I expected more. To say the least. Even a thorough scrubbing with baking soda did not get it all out. And why should I be scrubbing it after it had water in it? I bet tomato sauce will do worse. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I do as product introduction,but the cookware stilll has white spots in it.
customer_reviews.author: Fangying

product_meta.title: All-Clad BD55512 D5 Brushed 18/10 Stainless Steel 5-Ply Bonded Dishwasher Safe Stock Pot with Lid Cookware, 12-Quart, Silver
product_meta.description:
Size:12-QuartAn essential for any kitchen, the All-Clad D5 12-Quart Stockpot is ideal for making stock, soups, and stews and for preparing food in large quantities. The pot's wide bottom allows for sautŽing ingredients before adding liquids. As with all cookware from All-Clad's D5 collection, this stockpot is constructed with bonded stainless steel for exceptional heating, especially in induction cooking. Its stick-resistant, 18/10 stainless steel interior and long, comfortable handle will make this an essential tool for your kitchen.

For Stocks, Soups, and Stews

This stock pot features a wide bottom surface, which conveniently allows you to sautŽ ingredients before adding liquids. The pot's size and design is also well-suited for canning, blanching, and preparing large meals. This 12-quart pot has two cast stainless steel handles and a lid for controlling evaporation.

From All-Clad's D5 Brushed Stainless Steel Collection

Cookware from the All-Clad D5 collection feature bonded five-ply construction with alternating layers of stainless steel and aluminum. This layered construction eliminates warping and enables even heating. And with 18/10 stainless steel interiors, D5 cookware is stick-resistant and non-reactive to food. Pieces from this collection feature brushed stainless steel exteriors that complement many kitchen styles.

Compatible with a Range of Cooking Surfaces

All D5 products are optimized for induction cooking, but provide perform well on all stove ranges, in the oven, or under the broiler. The pieces are also dishwasher safe for easy, convenient cleaning.

What's in the Box

All-Clad D5 12-Quart Stockpot and lid.
feature_bullets: Brushed exterior. Heat source : Gas ,electric ,ceramic and halogen
Engraved capacity marking on the bottom of every pan
Long, riveted stick handle stays cool on the cooktop while easy-grip loop handles provide stability
Convenient rolled lip for easy pouring; 18/10 stainless steel cooking surface will not react with food

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars146 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
